document_data.name: Takosh-Re
document_data.mainbody: '''Takosh-Re''' was a [[pharaoh]] from the dynasty of [[Mo-Pelar]] and the father of [[Amun-Re]].{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|30}}
document_data.Legacy:
Per the ''Book of Amun-Re'', Amun-Re's father told him of the power of the waters of [[River Athis|Athis]], which they considered the very gift of [[Isis]], while Amun-Re was young. Upon his death, Takosh-Re was buried in the manner of other pharaohs, being succeeded by his son, Amun-Re.

When the younger pharaoh heard that his father's tomb may have been looted, he headed there alone. He became enraged and horrified by the desecration; this made Amun-Re vow that his tomb would be theft-proof, so that he could not be cheated of his place in Heaven Westward.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|42}}
